DOC.brief_summary: Neurally adjusted ventilatory assist (NAVA) and Proportional Assist Ventilatory Plus (PAV +) are new modes of mechanical ventilation that delivers ventilatory assist in proportion to the electrical activity of the diaphragm for NAVA and to patients efforts for PAV +. The goal of this trial is to compare oxygenation,ventilator comfort, patients -ventilator asynchronies, and sleep pattern between NAVA and PAV+.
DOC.brief_title: "NAVA-PAV" Study: a Cross-over Comparative Study of 2 Advanced Modes
DOC.detailed_description: Twenty patients will be enrolled. They will be ventilated with PAV+ and NAVA for one day, each in a randomized crossover order. The oxygenation,ventilator comfort, patients -ventilator asynchronies, and sleep pattern will be compared.
DOC.criteria: Estimated remaining duration of mechanical ventilation for more than two days patient alert and calm Surrogate decision maker's consent Clinical contraindication for the use of NAVA: contraindications for an EAdi catheter placement (e.g., esophageal varices, upper gastrointestinal bleeding, gastroesophageal surgery) Clinical instability for any reason Contraindications for continuing intensive care treatment Patient under tutelage Age < 18 years Pregnancy No French health insurance
